text:
KAÅ KALKAN
LÄ°MAN BÃ–LGESÄ°NDE SAHÄ°BÄ° KÃ–PEÄE BUNU YAPANI ARIYOR.

Sandra Osborneâ€Friends of KAPSA - Kalkan association for the protection of street animals
July 7, 2019 at 10:50 AM Â·

Earlier today this dog wandered into someones garden, they were very shocked and alerted one of our volunteers. We know of a few of this breed locally and set about attempting to trace an owner. We have managed to do so, the dog was wandering last night and has arrived back in this condition! Linda and I visited and we are 100% sure that the owner, his staff and their business neighbours, did not do this! They are as shocked and upset as we are. The dog is already being treated for a skin condition and the pen marks will not help its allergies. He will investigate the best thing to do for the dog, apparently it doesn't like baths! There are some cameras in the harbour area and the local authorities are also aware..... It may have been a drunken prank but animals are not toys or play things, the drawings are pretty nasty and could be on him for a while. Completely unacceptable behaviour.......

Chinese Animal Activists. The Forgotten Heros
June 15, 2019 at 10:27 AM Â·

Animal lovers and owners in China really are at their wits end. They face the threat everyday of dog traffickers maybe stealing their dogs and even some police make it hard for citizens to own a pet. The man in the video posted here was out walking his dog and was stopped by an officer. Even though the owner had his dog on a leash and produced a dog licence the policeman still insisted he was going to seize the dog. The owner knew he most likely would not see his best friend again so he fought back. Why aren't the police as strict with butchers when it comes to paperwork but harass law abiding citizens instead? Good on this owner for fighting for his beloved dog.

text:
World Animal Protection
December 13, 2017 at 5:35 PM Â·

Anokha, meaning 'unique', is a nine-year old Asiatic black bear. Kainat, meaning 'the universe' is a seven-year old Himalayan brown bear. These beautiful bears were used for baiting and dancing and kept in terrible conditions. Thanks to our work with the Bioresource Research Centre (BRC) they can now start a new life in a bear sanctuary.

Learn more about our work protecting bears: http://ow.ly/9m2u30hcr6h

Moonju Park is with ê¹€ì¤€ì› and 7 others.

ì˜¤ëŠ˜ 2017ë…„ 12ì›” 9ì¼,

"President Moon Jae-in, please help us let the world know that Korea is not just a country that abuses animals." "President Moon, please ban dog and cat meat."

Today, on Dec. 9th 2017, Activists from around the country gathered for their 13th protest in front of the Gupo dog meat market in Busan.
Their plea was for the legal ban of dog meat, fueled by the recent tragedy of O-sun, a pet who was sold and killed at Gupo.
The shutdown of a dog meat market doesn't mean that dog meat itself is banned.However, it is meaningful that dog meat markets where people can purchase dog meat easily are shutting down.

Eating companion animals like dogs and cats must be banned!
